summary.purpose: Provides reusable SVG icon React components for status indicators: red X icons (error/failure) in two variants and a green checkmark (success/valid). These are pure React components that accept optional dimension props.
summary.problem_solved: Eliminates the need to duplicate inline SVG markup across the application for common status indicator icons, providing a consistent, customizable way to display validation and status states.

exports.name: RedXSvg
exports.description_one_line: React component rendering a red X icon inside a circle, used for error/failure status indication

exports.name: RedXSvg2
exports.description_one_line: React component rendering a standalone red X icon without circle border, used for dismissal or close actions

exports.name: GreenVSvg
exports.description_one_line: React component rendering a green checkmark icon inside a circle, used for success/valid status indication

symbols.name: SvgProps
symbols.description_one_line: Interface defining optional SVG dimension and viewBox properties for SVG icon components

details.what_it_does: Defines the optional properties that can be passed to SVG icon components to customize their rendering dimensions and coordinate system. Provides a consistent interface across all SVG component exports.

symbols.name: RedXSvg
symbols.description_one_line: React component rendering a red X icon inside a circle (32x32px by default), commonly used to indicate error, failure, or invalid status

params.name: props
params.description: Optional object containing width, height, and viewBox string properties to customize SVG dimensions

returns.description: A JSX.Element representing an SVG element with red (#FF4C2B) X and circle

details.what_it_does: Returns an SVG element displaying a red X mark (#FF4C2B) centered inside a red circular outline. The component is a stateless functional component that uses the optional SvgProps to customize dimensions. Default dimensions are 32x32 pixels with viewBox '0 0 32 32'.
details.rendered_ui_description: A 32x32px SVG icon displaying a red X mark (#FF4C2B) centered inside a red circular outline (#FF4C2B). The icon uses absolute positioning when used in tables via CSS classes.

extensive_correct.title: Using with custom dimensions

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Trying to pass unsupported props
incorrect.why_incorrect: The RedXSvg component only accepts the SvgProps interface properties (width, height, viewBox). Trying to pass additional props like 'color' will be ignored. The color is hardcoded as #FF4C2B in the SVG itself.

symbols.name: RedXSvg2
symbols.description_one_line: React component rendering a standalone red X icon without circle border (18x18px by default), commonly used for close/dismiss actions

params.name: props
params.description: Optional object containing width, height, and viewBox string properties to customize SVG dimensions

returns.description: A JSX.Element representing an SVG element with red (#e90404) X mark

details.what_it_does: Returns an SVG element displaying a standalone red X mark (#e90404) without a surrounding circle. The component is a stateless functional component optimized for smaller display sizes than RedXSvg. Default dimensions are 18x18 pixels with viewBox '0,0,256,256'.
details.rendered_ui_description: An 18x18px SVG icon displaying a clean red X mark (#e90404) suitable for close buttons, dismissal actions, or compact error indicators.

minimal_correct.title: Basic close button usage

extensive_correct.title: Using in modal close and error states

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using in situations where circle border is needed
incorrect.why_incorrect: RedXSvg2 is designed for close buttons and dismissal actions with its standalone X. For validation error messages, use RedXSvg which includes the circular border for better visual emphasis and status indication.

symbols.name: GreenVSvg
symbols.description_one_line: React component rendering a green checkmark icon inside a circle (32x32px by default), commonly used to indicate success, completion, or valid status

params.name: props
params.description: Optional object containing width, height, and viewBox string properties to customize SVG dimensions

returns.description: A JSX.Element representing an SVG element with green (#3B8F08) checkmark and circle

details.what_it_does: Returns an SVG element displaying a green checkmark (#3B8F08) centered inside a green circular outline. The component is a stateless functional component mirroring RedXSvg but using green colors for positive status indication. Default dimensions are 32x32 pixels with viewBox '0 0 32 32'.
details.rendered_ui_description: A 32x32px SVG icon displaying a green checkmark (#3B8F08) centered inside a green circular outline (#3B8F08). The icon provides a clear visual indicator of successful validation or completion.

minimal_correct.title: Basic success status display

extensive_correct.title: Using in form validation feedback

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using GreenVSvg for error states
incorrect.why_incorrect: GreenVSvg is specifically for success and valid states. Using it for error messages creates a confusing UX where the green checkmark contradicts the error message. Use RedXSvg for error states instead.
